meanings.definition: In a circular or surrounding route or direction.
meanings.sent1: The children ran around the playground.
meanings.sent2: She likes to walk around the park every morning.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased its tail around in circles.
meanings.sent4: The dancers moved around the stage gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The earth revolves around the sun.

meanings.sent1: I have around ten apples in my bag.
meanings.sent2: The store is around the corner.
meanings.sent3: He has been waiting for around an hour.
meanings.sent4: The temperature is around 70 degrees Fahrenheit.
meanings.sent5: The journey will take around two hours.

meanings.sent1: There is a cafe around the corner.
meanings.sent2: The library is around the block.
meanings.sent4: The hotel is around the airport.
meanings.sent5: The park is around the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Moving in a circle or circuit.
meanings.sent1: The around path led us back to the starting point.
meanings.sent2: The around motion of the carousel made me dizzy.
meanings.sent3: The around movement of the clock's hands fascinated the child.
meanings.sent4: The around track of the racecourse challenged the runners.
meanings.sent5: The around pattern of the dance routine impressed the audience.
